Porter, 1931, at right]] '''John Clinton Porter''', born in [[Leon, Iowa]] (April 4, c. 1872 – May 27, 1959) was a [[United States of America|U.S.]] [[political figure]]. He served as the 33rd [[Mayor of Los Angeles]] between 1929 and 1933, and ran for re-election twice more but was defeated in 1933 by [[Frank L. Shaw]] and in 1941 by [[Fletcher Bowron]]. He died of a heart and lung condition in [[Los Angeles, California]] in 1959, and was buried at [[Forest Lawn Memorial Park (Hollywood Hills)|Forest Lawn Memorial Park]] in the Hollywood Hills. ==Prior History== Porter was a senior member of the Ku Klux Klan during its popular resurgence in the early 1920s [http://www.sandiegohistory.org/journal/2000-2/klan.htm] == Bibliography == *''Chronological Record of Los Angeles City Officials: 1850—1938'', Compiled under Direction of Municipal Reference Library City Hall, Los Angeles March 1938 (Reprinted 1966) == External links == * {{Find a Grave|6246}} {{LosAngelesMayor}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Porter, John Clinton | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 1872 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1959 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Porter, John Clinton}} [[Category:1872 births]] [[Category:1959 deaths]] [[Category:Mayors of Los Angeles, California]] [[Category:Ku Klux Klan members]] {{California-mayor-stub}}
